channel.title: Achievements?
channel.description: I was wondering how you would make something I'm guessing a method that can tell you how many logs cut or ores mined for achievements?

item.title: Achievements?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Someone released an achievement handler on R-S (maybe here too?). You should really use it instead of creating 300 variables and naming them all, and putting it into the playersave…

Read full topic

item.title: Achievements?
item.dc:creator: @extenze007 extenze007
item.description:
@extenze007 wrote:

[quote=“ravekitty, post:5, topic:535383”]If you haven’t already

declare an int in the player class named something like public int logsCut; the name doesn’t really matter.

in the woodcutting class, under wherever it adds the logs to your inventory

add c.logsCut++;

And you can display the amount of logs you’ve cut through a command or on an interface

If you haven’t added the information to the player save class, let me know and I’ll try to help you with that as well

p.s I think I may have misunderstood the question.[/quote]
Thanks worked fine!

Read full topic

item.title: Achievements?
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

If you haven’t already

declare an int in the player class named something like public int logsCut; the name doesn’t really matter.

in the woodcutting class, under wherever it adds the logs to your inventory

add c.logsCut++;

And you can display the amount of logs you’ve cut through a command or on an interface

If you haven’t added the information to the player save class, let me know and I’ll try to help you with that as well

p.s I think I may have misunderstood the question.

Read full topic
